subject: Re: [junit] failed assumption reports as passed instead of ignored
msgSnippet: Stefan, Failed assumptions _should_ be treated as ignored.  Unfortunately, at the time assumptions were released, Eclipse had bad behavior if a test method was
messageBody:
Stefan,

Failed assumptions _should_ be treated as ignored. Unfortunately, at
the time assumptions were released, Eclipse had bad behavior if a test
method was first started, and then ignored, so I rolled back this
change at the last minute, without updating the documentation. Please
remind me until this is fixed.

David Saff

On Wed, Jul 1, 2009 at 3:12 PM, stefan_lun<stefan_lun@...> wrote:
> Hi!
> I read from the documentation that failed assumptions should be reported as ignored test cases but when I'm trying to use them my test cases are passed though failed assumptions.
>
> In what way should they behave?
> In junit code it's stated as they should pass which I think is incorrect.
> See Result.java:testAssumptionFailure.
>
> Could anyone clarify on this please.
> /Stefan
>
> additional note, I've read some posts that assumptions work
> in my expected way when used in beforeclass. But all doc says
> that it should be usable on individual test cases too.
>
>
>
>
> ------------------------------------
>
> Yahoo! Groups Links
>
>
>
